# ğŸ“ .github Directory

This directory contains GitHub-specific configuration files and templates for the **Converso Downloader** project.

---

## ğŸ“‹ Contents

### ğŸ› Issue Templates

Located in `ISSUE_TEMPLATE/`:

- **`bug_report.yml`** - Template for reporting bugs
  - Structured form for consistent bug reports
  - Includes fields for version, platform, steps to reproduce
  - Helps us fix issues faster

- **`feature_request.yml`** - Template for suggesting new features
  - Helps us understand feature requests clearly
  - Includes use cases and priority assessment
  - Community contribution section

- **`question.yml`** - Template for asking questions
  - For users who need help
  - Categorized by topic
  - Quick support access

- **`config.yml`** - Issue template configuration
  - Disables blank issues
  - Provides helpful links
  - Directs users to appropriate resources

### ğŸ”€ Pull Request Template

- **`pull_request_template.md`** - Template for all pull requests
  - Structured PR format
  - Comprehensive checklist
  - Testing requirements
  - Code quality standards

### ğŸ“š Community Files

- **`CONTRIBUTING.md`** - Contribution guidelines
  - How to contribute code
  - Coding standards
  - Development setup
  - PR process
  - Best practices

- **`CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md`** - Community code of conduct
  - Behavioral expectations
  - Enforcement policies
  - Reporting process
  - Based on Contributor Covenant

- **`SECURITY.md`** - Security policy
  - How to report vulnerabilities
  - Supported versions
  - Security best practices
  - Response timeline

- **`SUPPORT.md`** - Support resources
  - FAQ section
  - Getting help
  - Troubleshooting
  - Community resources

### âš™ï¸ Workflows

Located in `workflows/`:

- **`release.yml`** - Automated release workflow
  - Builds executables for Windows, macOS, Linux
  - Bundles FFmpeg with releases
  - Creates release packages
  - Publishes to GitHub Releases

### ğŸ’° Funding

- **`FUNDING.yml`** - Sponsorship configuration
  - Links to funding platforms
  - Currently shows Converso Empire link
  - Can be updated with specific funding sources

## ğŸ¯ Purpose

These templates and files serve several purposes:

### 1. **Consistency**
- Standardized issue and PR formats
- Easier to understand and process
- Better communication

### 2. **Efficiency**
- All necessary information collected upfront
- Faster issue resolution
- Less back-and-forth for clarification

### 3. **Professionalism**
- Well-organized project
- Clear processes and expectations
- Industry-standard practices

### 4. **Community**
- Clear contribution guidelines
- Welcoming environment
- Code of conduct protection

### 5. **Security**
- Responsible disclosure process
- Clear security policies
- User safety priority

## ğŸš€ Usage

### For Contributors

**Reporting a Bug:**
1. Go to [Issues](https://github.com/Converso-Empire/converso-downloader/issues/new/choose)
2. Select "ğŸ› Bug Report"
3. Fill out the template
4. Submit

**Requesting a Feature:**
1. Go to [Issues](https://github.com/Converso-Empire/converso-downloader/issues/new/choose)
2. Select "ğŸ’¡ Feature Request"
3. Fill out the template
4. Submit

**Asking a Question:**
1. Go to [Issues](https://github.com/Converso-Empire/converso-downloader/issues/new/choose)
2. Select "â“ Question / Help"
3. Fill out the template
4. Submit

**Submitting a PR:**
1. Fork the repository
2. Create your feature branch
3. Make your changes
4. Open a PR (template appears automatically)
5. Fill out the template
6. Submit for review

### For Maintainers

**All templates are automatically applied when:**
- Users create new issues
- Contributors open pull requests
- Community members interact with the project

**Customization:**
- Templates can be edited in this directory
- YAML templates (`.yml`) provide structured forms
- Markdown templates (`.md`) provide checklists

## ğŸ“ Template Guidelines

### Issue Templates

**Bug Reports:**
- Require specific information
- Platform and version details
- Reproduction steps
- Error logs

**Feature Requests:**
- Use cases required
- Priority assessment
- Alternative solutions
- Community contribution willingness

**Questions:**
- Categorized by topic
- Version information
- What user has tried
- Additional context

### Pull Request Template

**Required Information:**
- Description of changes
- Type of change
- Related issues
- Testing performed
- Checklist completion

---

## ğŸ”„ Maintenance

### Updating Templates

**When to update:**
- Adding new issue categories
- Changing required information
- Improving clarity
- Adding new workflows

**How to update:**
1. Edit the relevant file in `.github/`
2. Test the template
3. Commit and push changes
4. Templates update automatically

### Version Control

All template changes are version controlled:
- Changes tracked in git history
- Can revert if needed
- Transparent modifications

---

## ğŸŒŸ Best Practices

### For Template Design

1. **Keep it Simple**
   - Don't overwhelm users
   - Ask only necessary questions
   - Use clear language

2. **Be Specific**
   - Provide examples
   - Explain why information is needed
   - Use placeholders

3. **Make it Accessible**
   - Use dropdown menus
   - Provide checkboxes
   - Include help text

4. **Stay Professional**
   - Converso Empire branding
   - Consistent formatting
   - Clear communication

### For Users

1. **Fill Out Completely**
   - Provide all requested information
   - Be specific and detailed
   - Include relevant context

2. **Search First**
   - Check existing issues
   - Read documentation
   - Try troubleshooting

3. **Be Respectful**
   - Follow code of conduct
   - Be patient
   - Thank contributors
